definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He misses. The seal dives into his ice hole and is gone.
sentences.chinese: 湯米開槍了，但是沒有擊中，海豹潛入冰洞中消失了。

sentences.english: As such, the creatures try keep their prey alive within their icy caves.
sentences.chinese: 因此，這些生物試圖讓獵物在它們的冰洞中活着。

sentences.english: Wampas live in caves carved from the Hoth ice.
sentences.chinese: 萬帕住在霍斯的冰洞中。

sentences.english: Sid finds the dinosaurs eggs in an ice cave.
sentences.chinese: 地獺席德在冰洞裏找到了恐龍蛋。

sentences.english: While the second ice located in Zhongnanshan Shengjing, icing is not year-round.
sentences.chinese: 而太乙冰洞地處終南勝境，洞內積冰更是終年不化。

definition: "heavenly lake", lake situated on a mountain/used as the name of numerous lakes, such as 長白山天池|长白山天池[Chang2 bai2 shan1 Tian1 chi2]
